ca.ucalgary.seng300.a2

Class VendingManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.ucalgary.seng300.a2.VendingManager

  • public class VendingManager
extends java.lang.Object
    VendingManager is the primary access-point for the logic controlling the VendingMachine hardware. USAGE: Pass VendingMachine to static method initialize(), which returns the singleton instance Later, you can use getInstance() to get the existing instance. Listeners are registered automatically. DESIGN: All listeners except DispListiner are designed as singletons. Currently, the only public-access methods are for initialization. This was done to enforce strong encapsulation of the logic classes in an attempt to prevent misuse. LAYOUT: SETUP: Sets up the VendingManager and related classes HARDWARE ACCESSORS: Methods to get hardware instances or information about them HARDWARE ACTIONS: Methods to interact with the hardware in some way LOGIC INTERNALS: Methods that do not modify the hardware directly
    Author:
    Thomas Coderre (10169277), Jason De Boer (30034428), Khesualdo Condori (30004958), Michaela Olsakova (30002591), Paul Dan (30011349), Dan Dunareanu (30002346)

      • getCoinRackValue

        int getCoinRackValue(CoinRack coinRack)
        Returns the coin value in the given CoinRack.
        Parameters:
        coinRack - The CoinRack to check the value for.
        Returns:
        The value (in cents) of the stored coins.

      • getCredit

        public int getCredit()
        Gets the credit available for purchases, in cents. Public access for testing and external access. It is assumed to not be a security vulnerability.
        Returns:
        The stored credit, in cents.

      • enableSafety

        void enableSafety()
        Used by calling code to to enable the safety. If the safety is not already enabled, it will always relay the message to the hardware.

      • disableSafety

        void disableSafety()
        Used by calling code to *attempt* to disable the safety. The calling code is assumed to be ignorant of system state, so there are many cases where this will be called but the message will not be relayed to the hardware.

      • buy

        void buy(int popIndex)
  throws InsufficientFundsException,
         EmptyException,
         DisabledException,
         CapacityExceededException
        Handles a pop purchase. Checks if the pop rack has pop, confirms funds available, dispenses the pop, reduces available funds and deposits the added coins into storage.
        Parameters:
        popIndex - The index of the selected pop rack.
        Throws:
        InsufficientFundsException - Thrown if credit < cost.
        EmptyException - Thrown if the selected pop rack is empty.
        DisabledException - Thrown if the pop rack or delivery chute is disabled.
        CapacityExceededException - Thrown if the delivery chute is full.

      • returnChange

        void returnChange()
           throws CapacityExceededException,
                  EmptyException,
                  DisabledException
        A method for returning change. May not return exact change. Dispenses the largest denominations first.
        Throws:
        DisabledException - Some necessary hardware is disabled
        EmptyException - CoinSlot is empty and a coin removal was attempted
        CapacityExceededException - DeliveryChute is full

        void display(java.lang.String msg)

        Parameters:
        msg - The message to be displayed.

      • getDescendingRackValues

        int[] getDescendingRackValues()
        Takes the coin values inside the machine and sorts them in descending order for the purpose of change return
        Returns:
        coins denominations in descending order as an array

      • checkExactChangeState

        public boolean checkExactChangeState()
        Checks that exact change could be provided for each possible purchase, given the current credit.
        Returns:
        True if exact change can be provided for each purchase

      • canReturnExactChange

        boolean canReturnExactChange(int cost)
        Checks if valid change can be returned, but does not return anything. Similar to returnChange, but sets the indicator light instead
        Parameters:
        cost - The cost (in cents) of a hypothetical purchase
        Returns:
        Whether exact change could be provided for an item of the given cost

      • checkAllProductsEmpty

        boolean checkAllProductsEmpty()
        Checks if all of the pop racks are empty.
        Returns:
        True if all are empty, else false

      • isOutOfOrder

        boolean isOutOfOrder()
        Checks the machine state to determine whether it is out of order. Checks the status of the delivery chute, coin receptacle, and inventory.

      • log

        void log(java.lang.String msg)
        Provides a simplified interface for the Logger.log() methods. See details in ca.ucalgary.seng300.a2.Logger.
        Parameters:
        msgs - String array of events to log. None can be null or empty.

        Parameters:
